testcase.name: testGameOver

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: The game ends when as the head of the snake collides with the rest of the snake. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=0, actions=<> Want | Got ✗ --------------- OO>A.. | ...... ...... | ...... ...... | ......
step=1, rand=6, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OO>.. | ...... ...A.. | ...... ...... | ......
step=2, rand=6, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OOO>. | ...... ...A.. | ...... ...... | ......
step=3, rand=6, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OOOO> | ...... ...A.. | ...... ...... | ......
step=4, rand=6, actions=<ChangeDir(South()), Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OOOOO | ...... ...A.v | ...... ...... | ......
step=5, rand=6, actions=<ChangeDir(West()), Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- ..OOOO | ...... ...A<O | ...... ...... | ......
step=6, rand=6, actions=<ChangeDir(North()), Step> Want | Got ✗ -------------------------- GameOverDisplay() | ...... | ...... | ......

testcase.name: testPreciselyDoesNotDie

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: The game should not end if the tail of the snake is exactly at the next position of the head (and the snake does not grow) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=0, actions=<> Want | Got ✗ --------------- OO>A.. | ...... ...... | ......
step=1, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OO>.. | ...... A..... | ......
step=2, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OOO>. | ...... A..... | ......
step=3, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- .OOOO> | ...... A..... | ......
step=4, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- >OOOOO | ...... A..... | ......
step=5, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- O>OOOO | ...... A..... | ......
step=6, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- OO>OOO | ...... A..... | ......
step=7, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- OOO>OO | ...... A..... | ......
step=8, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- OOOO>O | ...... A..... | ......
step=9, rand=3, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ --------------- OOOOO> | ...... A..... | ......

testcase.name: testNoEscapeGameOver

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: The snake should not move anymore after the game is over, hence it should not be possible to “escape” from a game over by moving though the snake. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=0, actions=<> Want | Got ✗ ------------- OO>A. | ..... ..... | ..... ..... | ..... ..... | .....
step=1, rand=0, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------- AOO>. | ..... ..... | ..... ..... | ..... ..... | .....
step=2, rand=0, actions=<ChangeDir(South()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------- AOOO. | ..... ...v. | ..... ..... | ..... ..... | .....
step=3, rand=0, actions=<ChangeDir(West()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------- AOOO. | ..... ..<O. | ..... ..... | ..... ..... | .....
step=4, rand=0, actions=<ChangeDir(North()), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------- GameOverDisplay() | ..... | ..... | ..... | .....
step=5, rand=0, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------- GameOverDisplay() | ..... | ..... | ..... | .....
